intro: Aspidosperma lundellianum, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or *Cupania lundelliana*, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, yellowish fruit that contains several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
